result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C Toth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 days credit against any sentence, if imposed. 
*Defendant may request early termination of probation after 6 months with Agent approval.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.

Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract

Defendant Joseph C Toth in court with Attorney Breanne Marie Bucher.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #4.  Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made.  Repeat enhancer is stricken. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract (copies of contract provided to parties) and forwards the file to DTC. Court modifies bail to include compliance with DTC program and to comply with WCS monitoring.
